item.title: [128] AI Pok√©mon Thread 188 /NAPT/: Carminona's Feet Edition
item.description:
This is a general thread for people to post their AI art and/slash/or make requests from others who may want to attempt making their own Pok√©mon-related gens.

NovelAI is a paid AI generator. Opus tier users have "unlimited" Small/Normal generations, though editing tools require credits.

Microsoft's Bing AI is a free image generator that is powered by DALL¬∑E 3.

Civitai is free using its ‚Äòbuzz‚Äô currency. You get a certain amount every day, plus more for liking models and gens.
>civitai.com

Otaiku is a (mostly) free mobile app. An ad watch is required between each image generation unless you pay.
>ailla.biz/otaiku

Tensor is free to use as well, although you are limited to how many gens you can make per day.
>https://tensor.art/

Local Generation using Stable Diffusion requires a decent video card. Guides for local genning can be found in the /g/ threads:
>>>/g/sdg
>>>/g/ldg
Other Stable Diffusion threads are on: /h/, /e/, /d/, /b/, /vt/, /aco/, /trash/

Hailuo AI takes uploaded art and animates them based on the prompts you get. You get a 3-day free trial, followed by roughly 3 free gens a day afterward. Subscription plans are available.
>https://hailuoai.video/

Pastebin of Pok√©mon artists:
>https://pastebin.com/U0mmK3Tm (embed)

Characters with under 300 images will require more tags to have them look correct. This is a list of all Pok√©mon characters with over 300 images:
>https://danbooru.donmai.us/posts?tags=*_%28pokemon%29+&z=5

If you plan on sharing multiple images together, we'd recommend posting just one, and give links for the rest. This way we can conserve space.

This is a locally run html tool provided by ThatOneAiAnon. It keeps track of all artists you like and turns Danbooru's entire tag system in a collapsible list of buttons. You can edit all the js, css, html code to modify the tool. (Ask him for updated versions or more Nai4 tools)
>mega .nz/file/67xwTRSB#m0fPUmJRaWd3oh47gt6nw2LKNMe820TaiKdXTAhx8tI

Previous Thread: >>57801506

Original filename: 1747494597337729.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 33] Trump bans free speech
item.description:
https://apnews.com/article/trump-melania-intimate-imagery-bill-sign-c7416b4935f8ccac9fd2909e494da9f1
President Donald Trump on Monday signed into law the Take It Down Act, a measure that imposes penalties for online sexual exploitation that first lady Melania Trump helped usher through Congress, and he had her sign it, too, despite what sounded like a mild objection on her part.

‚ÄúC‚Äômon, sign it anyway,‚Äù the president told his wife. ‚ÄúShe deserves to sign it,‚Äù he said.

After she added her signature, the president held up the document to show both of their names to the audience at the ceremony in the White House Rose Garden. Melania Trump‚Äôs signature is merely symbolic since first ladies are not elected and they play no role in the enactment of legislation.

In March, Melania Trump used her first public appearance since resuming the role of first lady to travel to Capitol Hill to lobby House members to pass the bill following its approval by the Senate.

At a signing ceremony, she called the new law a ‚Äúnational victory‚Äù that will help protect children from online exploitation, including through the use of artificial intelligence to make fake images.

‚ÄúAI and social media are the digital candy for the next generation, sweet addictive and engineered to have an impact on the cognitive development of our children,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúBut unlike sugar, these new technologies can be weaponized, shape beliefs and, sadly, affect emotions and even be deadly.‚Äù

The president said the proliferation of images made using AI means that ‚Äúcountless women have been harassed with deepfakes and other explicit images distributed against their will.‚Äù He said what‚Äôs happening is ‚Äújust so horribly wrong.‚Äù

‚ÄúToday, we‚Äôre making it totally illegal,‚Äù Trump said.

Original filename: 1746022976527415.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 31] /Luxe/ Luxury Travel General
item.description:
This is for the boys who who make real money and splash serious cash on travel (at least five figures per year).

Four Seasons, Aman, other magnificent resorts and villas.

First class airline travel, private lounges, personal jets.

Top notch restaurants.

Five figures to spend on guided tours, charter yachts, unique experiences most normals will never taste. Escorts and exotic sugar babies who will make you nut out of body. Crazy remote locations. Gambling and designer fashion shipping. Literal White Lotus shit, the sky's the limit.

I know not everybody here is a twenty-something slumming it in hostels. Let's hear travel reports from the high IQ successful men with money to burn.

item.title: [ 43] Meal Prep
item.description:
Let's talk and or bitch about meal prep.

Recently I asked ChatGPT for a meal prep plan for a week's worth of food. Was looking for something along Keto guidelines cause those are my dietary restrictions currently.

My hopes were to have a more balanced meal every day as I am too lazy to prepare multiple ingredients and end up eating very basic food, think, eggs and a burger patty alone.

What it came up with, and what I ultimately made was a Greek chicken rice bowl thing, except with riced cauliflower instead.

The components ended up being
Mediterranean Seasoned Boneless Chicken Thighs
Riced Cauliflower with Wilted Spinach
Roasted Vegetable Mix consisting of Zucchini, Eggplant, and Bell Peppers

I use three containers to store it and weigh out my portions every day while eating. Next week I'm going to do a beef based dish instead.

Not gonna lie it took about 2 hours to get everything done, and I had to bake the chicken in two batches for 25 minutes each because I didn't have the pan or oven space, portioning and reheating takes about 5 minutes total so that is nice. I'll continue experimenting and see if it's something I can get more comfortable with.

Original filename: file.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [148] Central air conditioning outside of North America
item.description:
How the fuck do I acquire a residential ducted central air conditioning system like in the U.S. (i.e. NOT a mini split) if I don't live in the U.S. or Canada? How come it's only popular in these two countries, plus MAYBE Australia and New Zealand? Is it possible to install this system, perhaps in a new house, outside of these countries? Does anyone even build air ducts outside of the U.S.?

item.title: [ 31] US: 2 dead after Mexican Navy ship hits Brooklyn Bridge
item.description:
https://nypost.com/2025/05/17/us-news/ship-carrying-200-people-hits-the-brooklyn-bridge-as-search-and-rescue-operation-underway/

At least two people were killed and 19 others injured after a Mexican Navy training sailing ship collided with the iconic Brooklyn Bridge during a promotional tour on Saturday, New York City Mayor Eric Adams said.

"At this time, of the 277 on board, 19 sustained injuries, 2 of which remain in critical condition, and 2 more have sadly passed away from their injuries," Adams posted on X.


Nick Corso, a witness, told AFP that it looked like there was a lot of panic aboard the vessel with "lots of screaming" and "some sailors hanging from the masts."

The Cuauhtemoc, a barque built in 1982 with a mast height of 48.2 meters (158 feet) had been on a training maneuver at the time and was damaged in the "mishap," a statement posted by the Mexican Navy on X said.

The cause of the collision is under investigation.

Original filename: file.png

item.title: [255] /jpg/ - Japan General
item.description:
Vending Machine Edition

„Éº How do I travel by public transportation? „Éº
Use Google Maps within cities, install the Jorudan or Navitime app for intercity travel

„Éº What should I see in <place>? „Éº
https://www.wikivoyage.org/
https://www.japan-guide.com/
https://www.jnto.go.jp/
>Solid general guides - sights, sample itineraries, pre-travel considerations, etc
https://www.google.com/maps/d/edit?mid=1fmfaySQHmojbRGKWCwRecq6Ln1Bb2Xdh&ll=35.67928012473078%2C139.68638283648374&z=12
*You should check on google if a place is still in business before you plan to visit it*

„ÉºJR Pass„Éº
Since JR has adjusted the prices for the pass, not really worth it anymore, unless you want to travel by train very extensively. You can plug in your itinerary in the links below and compare prices to the JR Pass.
>https://japantravel.navitime.com/en/area/jp/route/
>https://world.jorudan.co.jp/mln/en/
With the increased price of the JR Pass, local train passes might be good deals now.
>https://www.japan-guide.com/e/e2357.html

New prices starting May 2024
>7 day Pass: ¬•50,000
>14 day Pass: ¬•80,000
>21 day Pass: ¬•100,000
https://www.japan-guide.com/railpass/

„ÉºInfo on Degeneracy „Éº
READ THE INFO LISTED HERE. STOP TALKING ABOUT IT IN THE THREAD.

>https://chn.cityheaven.net/
>https://rockitrisingsun.com
>https://paradise-tokyo.net
>https://hentaitokyo.com
>https://tokyoadultguide.com/

item.title: [227] Cake and dessert thread
item.description:
Thread for desserts you've made, discussion and questions. Feel free to post and rate.

Starting with a cake I made and am currently eating.

Base is biscuits with cinnamon. There is a thin layer of cherry jam on on top of the base.
The main body is mascarpone mousse, with strawberry and quark.
Top layer is vanilla and white chocolate. The red pattern is the same stuff, with a bit of coloring.
On top I have some strawberries and basil. The strawberries were not really good. They are imported at this time of year where I live, so they are mainly for show, not for flavor.
Basil is my home grown and really goes well with strawberry.

Original filename: 100_0684.jpg

item.title: [ 45] Hey voyagers, The sticky probably needs to be updated, I'll keep the thread
item.description:
Hey voyagers,

The sticky probably needs to be updated, I'll keep the thread open for suggestions:

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

/trv/ is a slow board, so don't expect immediate responses. CHECK THE CATALOG ‚Äì you might find threads already discussing topics you're interested in.

Before asking for suggestions, tell /trv/ about your:
>Budget
>Interests
>Level of understanding of the local language(s)
This makes it easier to give quality advice. Of course, keep your posts travel related.

For all other matters:
General culture questions >>>/int/
Politics discussion >>>/pol/
Transportation discussion >>>/n/
Outdoors-related discussion >>>/out/

For more information about safety, planning and other miscellaneous topics, check out the pastebin:

GENERAL INFO:
https://pastebin.com/yR1SAr3s

Note: Discussions of prostitution or sex tourism are not permitted on /trv/.

Original filename: trv.png
